title: Kinetic Theory - RMS speed of an ideal gas

content.question: A monatomic ideal gas consists of atoms with mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>. The gas has temperature <math alttext="T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and the root-mean-square velocity of the gas atoms is <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The temperature of the gas is then doubled to temperature <math alttext="T sub 2 equals 2 T sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. The root-mean-square velocity of the gas atoms at <math alttext="T sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 1 equals v sub 2, which equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, v sub 1 equals v sub 2, close parenthesis which is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2, which is greater than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub 2 is greater than 2 v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2, which is greater than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
